subject: Biotechnology

overview.description: Applied biotechnology curriculum focusing on agricultural applications, genetic engineering, microbiology, and bioprocessing technologies

learning_objectives: Understand fundamental principles of biotechnology and genetic engineering
Apply microbiology techniques in agricultural contexts
Develop skills in tissue culture and plant propagation
Analyze biotechnology applications in crop improvement
Evaluate ethical and safety considerations in biotechnology

units.title: Introduction to Agricultural Biotechnology
learning_outcomes: Understand basic concepts of biotechnology and genetic engineering
Identify applications of biotechnology in agriculture
Recognize the role of DNA and genes in crop improvement
Evaluate benefits and risks of biotechnology

lessons.title: DNA Structure and Genetic Engineering Basics
objectives: Understand DNA structure and function in inheritance
Explain basic principles of genetic modification
Identify tools and techniques used in genetic engineering

activities.description: Build 3D DNA models to understand structure and base pairing
Simulate genetic engineering process using paper models
Analyze real examples of genetically modified crops
Discuss implications of genetic modification in agriculture

lessons.title: GMO Crops and Agricultural Applications
objectives: Identify different types of genetically modified crops
Understand traits commonly modified in agricultural biotechnology
Evaluate the impact of GMOs on farming practices

activities.description: Research different GMO crops and their modified traits
Compare conventional vs GMO crop characteristics
Present findings on specific GMO crop applications
Debate pros and cons of GMO adoption in agriculture

assessment_criteria: Quality of research and information gathering (30%)
cross_curricular_connections: Environmental Science: Ecological impacts of biotechnology

units.title: Microbiology and Fermentation Technology
learning_outcomes: Understand microbial diversity and agricultural applications
Master aseptic techniques and microbial cultivation
Apply fermentation processes in agricultural biotechnology
Develop skills in microbial quality control

lessons.title: Aseptic Techniques and Microbial Cultivation
objectives: Master sterile technique for microbial work
Prepare culture media and inoculate microorganisms
Observe and identify different microbial colonies

activities.description: Practice aseptic techniques and media preparation
Inoculate bacterial and fungal cultures using proper techniques
Record initial observations and set up incubation
Review laboratory safety protocols

lessons.title: Beneficial Microorganisms in Agriculture
objectives: Identify beneficial microorganisms used in agriculture
Understand nitrogen fixation and biofertilizers
Apply microbial biocontrol agents

activities.description: Identify beneficial bacteria and fungi under microscope
Test effectiveness of biofertilizers on plant growth
Prepare microbial inoculants for field application
Analyze and interpret experimental results

cross_curricular_connections: Environmental Science: Soil ecology and sustainability
Agriculture: Integrated pest and nutrient management

units.title: Plant Tissue Culture and Propagation
learning_outcomes: Understand plant growth regulators and their applications
Apply tissue culture for crop improvement

lessons.title: Plant Tissue Culture Establishment
objectives: Prepare sterile plant tissue culture media
Establish plant tissue cultures from different explants
Understand the role of plant growth regulators

activities.description: Prepare MS medium with different hormone combinations
Surface sterilize and prepare plant explants for culture
Establish tissue cultures in sterile conditions
Set up monitoring and maintenance schedule

resources: MS medium components and growth regulators
cross_curricular_connections: Biology: Plant physiology and cell biology
Chemistry: Plant hormone chemistry and solutions

lessons.title: Micropropagation and Commercial Applications
objectives: Understand different stages of micropropagation
Apply scaling-up techniques for mass production
Evaluate commercial viability of tissue culture

activities.description: Subculture and multiply plant tissue cultures
Transfer plantlets to greenhouse conditions
Analyze economics of commercial tissue culture operations
Evaluate plantlet quality and survival rates

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Business analysis and cost-benefit evaluation
Agriculture: Plant propagation and nursery management

units.title: Bioprocessing and Agricultural Products
learning_outcomes: Understand fermentation processes and bioreactor design
Apply biotechnology in food processing and preservation

lessons.title: Fermentation Technology and Bioreactors
objectives: Understand principles of aerobic and anaerobic fermentation
Design and operate small-scale bioreactors
Monitor and control fermentation parameters

activities.description: Set up small-scale fermentation systems
Monitor pH, temperature, and dissolved oxygen levels
Analyze fermentation products and byproducts
Discuss optimization strategies for fermentation

resources: pH meters and dissolved oxygen sensors
cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Biochemical reactions and process chemistry
Physics: Mass transfer and reactor engineering

lessons.title: Value-Added Agricultural Product Development
objectives: Develop biotechnology-based food products
Apply preservation techniques using microorganisms
Evaluate product quality and safety

activities.description: Develop fermented food products from agricultural raw materials
Test nutritional content and safety parameters
Analyze market potential for developed products
Present product development project results

cross_curricular_connections: Business Studies: Product development and marketing

core_laboratory_work: Plant tissue culture establishment and maintenance
Product analysis and quality control testing

formative_assessments: Weekly laboratory reports and technique evaluations

textbooks: Plant Tissue Culture: Theory and Practice
laboratory_equipment: Tissue culture laboratory with laminar flow hoods

career_connections: Quality control and regulatory affairs specialist
Agricultural extension officer specializing in biotechnology

cross_curricular_integration.chemistry: Biochemistry, analytical chemistry, and process chemistry
cross_curricular_integration.agriculture: Crop improvement, plant breeding, and sustainable farming
